claim.text: The proposed attribution method can identify knowledge neurons that express factual knowledge in pretrained Transformers.
claim.exact_quote: We propose an attribution method to identify knowledge neurons that express factual knowledge in pretrained Transformers.

evaluation.justification: The claim is based on the proposed method, but there is no evidence provided to support its effectiveness.

claim.text: Suppressing or amplifying the activation of knowledge neurons can accordingly affect the strength of knowledge expression.
claim.exact_quote: We find that suppressing or amplifying the activation of knowledge neurons can accordingly affect the strength of knowledge expression.

evaluation.justification: The claim is based on the observation, but there is no evidence provided to support the causal relationship between knowledge neuron activation and knowledge expression.

claim.text: Knowledge neurons tend to be activated by corresponding knowledge-expressing prompts.
claim.exact_quote: Moreover, quantitative and qualitative analysis on open-domain texts shows that knowledge neurons tend to be activated by the corresponding knowledge-expressing prompts.

evaluation.justification: The claim is based on the analysis of open-domain texts, but there is no evidence provided to show the generalization of the finding to other types of texts or tasks.

claim.text: The proposed method can be used to update or erase knowledge in pretrained Transformers.
claim.exact_quote: In addition, we present two preliminary case studies that attempt to utilize knowledge neurons to update or erase knowledge in pretrained Transformers.

evaluation.justification: The claim is based on preliminary case studies, but there is no evidence provided to show the effectiveness or generalizability of the approach.
